control.label: This is a test of a cool new version of WebViewer. Edit: It [CR]worked! :)
This is a test of a cool new version of WebViewer. Edit: It [CR]worked! :)

I'll be camping for a couple of days. When I get back I should be able to post an alpha version to [CR]my repo. I had some ideas floating around about how to make WebViewer be more like a web browser. I [CR]started testing them out and things went better than I had hoped :)
This is a test of a cool new version of WebViewer. Edit: It [CR]worked! :)

I'll be camping for a couple of days. When I get back I should be able to post an alpha version [CR]to my repo. I had some ideas floating around about how to make WebViewer be more like a web [CR]browser. I started testing them out and things went better than I had hoped :)
I look forward to trying it 8-)
Posted the first alpha version of WebViewer2 to my
This is very unfinished, and if you browse around enough, I'm sure you will get some errors
This is not a release per se, I'm just excited about the progress so far and want to show it off

The plan is to eventually merge this with the old WebViewer and allow the choice between the old and[CR]new WebViewer. Part of the reason for this is that this version requires the installation of a [CR]custom font, which aside from the mild skin modification that's needed, the current font does not [CR]support as many language characters (although I should be able to add other fonts later on).
Posted the first alpha version of WebViewer2 to my
This is very unfinished, and if you browse around enough, I'm sure you will get some errors
This is not a release per se, I'm just excited about the progress so far and want to show it off

The plan is to eventually merge this with the old WebViewer and allow the choice between the old [CR]and new WebViewer. Part of the reason for this is that this version requires the installation of a[CR]custom font, which aside from the mild skin modification that's needed, the current font does not[CR]support as many language characters (although I should be able to add other fonts later on).

Hi ruuk, I have tried webviewer2 (wv2) for a short while and I like what im seeing. I played youtube[CR]videos via the youtube website no problem and I followed your suggested links. I like the way this [CR]is going mate really impressed. What will (wv2) bring to FB. Keep up the good work, thanks.
